item.title: 安哥拉将关键利率维持在19.5%，以抑制通胀高企
item.description: 由于担心两位数的通货膨胀，安哥拉中央银行连续第四次维持借贷成本不变。【原文：Angola’s central bank kept borrowing costs unchanged for the fourth consecutive time over concerns about double-digit inflation.】

item.title: 旅游应用 Hopper 着眼于长期 IPO 计划，估值达 100 亿美元
item.description: 旅游数据提供商 Hopper Inc. 是加拿大最大的紧密型技术公司之一，其创始人认为该公司的上市价值将高达 100 亿美元。【原文：Travel data provider Hopper Inc., one of Canada’s largest closely held technology companies, is eyeing a public listing that its founder believes will value the business at as much as $10 billion.】

item.title: 谢因鲍姆说：墨西哥必须对特朗普的命令保持冷静
item.description: 克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆总统呼吁墨西哥人阅读唐纳德-特朗普周一签署的有关移民和贸易的行政命令的详细内容，同时重申她对移民和本国公民的支持。【原文：President Claudia Sheinbaum called on Mexicans to read the fine print of executive orders on immigration and trade that Donald Trump signed Monday, while reiterating her support for migrants and citizens of her nation.】

item.title: Paytm 创始人夏尔马期待银行重返商业领域
item.description: Paytm 的创始人希望他的银行能从印度监管机构获得新生，此前他已将该公司从他更大的金融科技帝国中剥离出来。【原文：Paytm’s founder expects his bank to get a fresh lease on life from Indian regulators, after he distanced that company from his larger fintech empire.】

item.title: Grindr 计划在人工智能推送中提供聊天摘要和新发现功能
item.description: Grindr Inc. 发布了其旗舰约会应用的几项重大更新，其中许多都采用了人工智能技术，以推动用户参与和收入增长。【原文：Grindr Inc. unveiled several major updates to its flagship dating app, many of them powered by artificial intelligence, in a bid to drive user engagement and revenue growth.】

item.title: 纳格尔称欧洲央行将在年中接近通胀目标
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，到 2025 年中期，欧洲中央银行应能接近其 2% 的通胀目标，从而能够将利率降至不再对经济构成压力的水平。【原文：The European Central Bank should be close to its 2% inflation goal by mid-2025, allowing it to lower interest rates to levels that no longer weigh on the economy, according to Governing Council member Joachim Nagel.】

item.title: 印度关系受挫，孟加拉国希望加深与中国的关系
item.description: 孟加拉国正计划与中国和其他东亚经济体建立更紧密的经济联系，而此时与印度的关系仍然紧张。【原文：Bangladesh is planning to build closer economic ties with China, and other East Asian economies, at a time when the relationship with India remains strained.】

item.title: 赢得欧盟支持后，法国财政部长确认赤字之路
item.description: 法国财政部长埃里克-隆巴德（Eric Lombard）表示，他的削减赤字方案得到了布鲁塞尔方面的支持，这对试图通过大规模削减开支来修复公共财政的法国政府来说是一个鼓舞。【原文：French Finance Minister Eric Lombard said he secured support from Brussels for his deficit-reduction path, in a boost for the government as it tries to push through massive spending cuts to repair public finances.】

item.title: 特鲁多减免销售税，加拿大通胀率降至 1.8
item.description: 自 2019 年以来，加拿大通胀率首次全年保持在央行的目标范围内，这是决策者在潜在关税战可能破坏其进展之前取得的一项成就。【原文：For the first time since 2019, Canadian inflation stayed within the central bank’s target range for a full year, a mark of achievement for policymakers ahead of a potential tariff war that threatens to derail their progress.】

item.title: 特朗普上任第一天的最新情况
item.description: 1月20日，华盛顿，唐纳德-特朗普在白宫椭圆形办公室签署行政命令时发表讲话。摄影师：Jim Lo Scalzo/EPA/Bloomberg【原文：Donald Trump speaks while signing executive orders in the Oval Office of the White House in Washington, DC, on Jan. 20. Photographer: Jim Lo Scalzo/EPA/Bloomberg】

item.description: 微策略公司（MicroStrategy Inc.【原文：MicroStrategy Inc. bought $1.1 billion of Bitcoin, as the company gears up for a shareholder vote on a 30 times increase its authorized Class A shares.】

item.title: 塔尔平斯的对冲基金返还 60 亿美元，主要用于管理现金
item.description: 杰夫-塔尔平斯（Jeff Talpins）的宏观交易对冲基金 Element Capital Management 去年返还了 60 多亿美元，缩小了资产规模，更接近于主要管理内部资金。【原文：Jeff Talpins’ macro trading hedge fund Element Capital Management returned more than $6 billion last year, shrinking its asset base and stepping closer to managing mostly internal money.】

item.title: 5 亿美元的 ETF 将成为减税趋势中的下一个重大举措
item.description: 一家总部位于密苏里州的财富管理公司准备加入这个规模虽小但却日益壮大的行列，将资产转入交易所交易基金，以帮助投资者减少税费支出，并准备推出规模最大的同类产品之一。【原文：A Missouri-based wealth manager is poised to join the small but growing list of firms who have flipped assets into exchange-traded funds to help investors slash their tax bills, prepping one of the largest launches of its kind.】

item.title: 分析师因 iPhone 疲软而下调评级，苹果一月份的艰难处境进一步恶化
item.description: 苹果公司的评级再次被分析师下调，这是一个最新迹象，表明由于人工智能未能成为人们所期望的增长催化剂，iPhone 销售疲软正日益成为投资者的担忧。【原文：Apple Inc. has received a fresh pair of analyst downgrades, in the latest sign that soft iPhone sales are becoming an increasing concern for investors, as artificial intelligence fails to act as a hoped-for growth catalyst.】

item.title: 瑞银首席执行官称瑞士面临资本计划反应过度的风险
item.description: 瑞银集团（UBS Group AG）首席执行官塞尔吉奥-埃尔莫蒂（Sergio Ermotti）表示，该银行正在反击瑞士政府要求其持有更多资本的建议，认为新规则的设计过于夸张，会损害竞争力。【原文：UBS Group AG Chief Executive Officer Sergio Ermotti said the bank is pushing back against the Swiss government’s proposals to make it hold substantially more capital, arguing that the design of new rules is over the top and will hurt competitiveness.】

item.description: 嘉信理财公司（Charles Schwab Corp.【原文：Charles Schwab Corp. reported results that exceeded estimates as it continues to attract record new inflows to its retail brokerage.】

item.title: Bawag 计划在 M&A 热潮之后将 SRT 与 24 亿欧元贷款挂钩
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Bawag 集团公司正在评估投资者对一项与约 24 亿欧元（25 亿美元）贷款组合相关的重大风险转移的兴趣，这是计划今年进行的三项此类交易中的第一项。【原文：Bawag Group AG is assessing investor interest for a significant risk transfer linked to a portfolio of about €2.4 billion ($2.5 billion) of loans, the first of three such deals planned for this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 如果首次公开募股（IPO）和销售不奏效，私募股权投资公司自有一套方案：更多债务
item.description: 在私募股权公司努力向投资者返还现金的同时，蓬勃发展的信贷市场为它们提供了一条救命稻草：与其依赖首次公开募股市场，他们可以让投资组合公司背负更多的债务，让自己获得回报。【原文：Booming credit markets are throwing private equity firms a lifeline as they strive to return cash to investors: Instead of relying on the IPO market, they can pile portfolio companies with more debt and give themselves a payout.】

item.title: 花旗银行认为美国企业赴欧洲采购将掀起交易热潮
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc.【原文：Citigroup Inc.’s top investment banker says US corporates are on the hunt for overseas deals thanks to a strong dollar, an easier regulatory regime and a widening gap in the multiples at which international companies are being valued.】

item.title: 特朗普在第一天发布一系列命令和赦免令后，进入第二天
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普在就职典礼后的 "第一天 "就采取了一系列旨在改变世界最大经济体走向的举措，这是他四年来首次在周二开始在白宫的一天。【原文：President Donald Trump starts his day in the White House Tuesday for the first time in four years, after an inauguration that unleashed a flurry of ‘day one’ moves designed to change the course of the world’s largest economy in his first hours in charge.】

item.title: 中国副总理誓言在躲过美国关税后增加进口
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将中国排除在他即将征收关税的国家之外数小时后，中国国务院副总理丁薛祥表示，中国将进口更多产品。【原文：Chinese Vice Premier Ding Xuexiang said China will import more products, hours after US President Donald Trump left the economy out of countries he’s looking to hit with tariffs imminently.】

item.title: 创新主管称停火将促进以色列科技资金的增长
item.description: 以色列创新负责人表示，由于加沙停火和利率降低，以色列科技初创企业今年有望筹集到比 2024 年更多的资金。【原文：Israeli technology startups are poised to raise more funds this year than in 2024 due to the Gaza ceasefire and lower interest rates, according to the nation’s innovation chief.】

item.title: 俄罗斯波罗的海重要港口石油流量意外骤降
item.description: 过去几周，俄罗斯位于波罗的海的第二大出口设施的石油出口量出人意料地大幅下滑，随着西方制裁的加强，这一下滑加剧了有关该国石油流动的更广泛问题。【原文：Russian oil exports from the country’s second-largest export facility in the Baltic Sea have plunged unexpectedly in the past several weeks, a slump that adds to wider questions about the nation’s petroleum flows as Western sanctions ramp up.】

item.title: 中央银行称特朗普 "钻井、钻井、钻井 "计划有助于肯尼亚
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）承诺释放更多肯尼亚的巨大能源储备，非洲国家中央银行行长表示，这可能会降低肯尼亚的消费价格增长。【原文：US President Donald Trump’s pledge to unlock more of that country’s vast stores of energy will likely lower Kenya’s consumer price growth, according to the chief of the African nation’s central bank.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税政策令主要贸易伙伴惶恐不安
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统在整个就职日几乎都在让人们猜测关税问题，直到他抛出一枚重磅炸弹。【原文：President Donald Trump kept people guessing about tariffs for almost all of Inauguration Day, before dropping a bombshell.】

item.title: 穆迪称保险公司有望加深与私人信贷的联系
item.description: 据穆迪评级公司（Moody's Ratings）的一份报告称，私人信贷和保险公司今年有望走得更近，这可能会促使监管机构检查两者之间的关系以及任何相关风险。【原文：Private credit and insurers are expected to get even closer this year, potentially prompting regulators to inspect ties between the two and any associated risk, according to a Moody’s Ratings report.】
